sen.j: 江文神社（えぶみじんじゃ）は京都府京都市左京区にある神社。
sen.e: Ebumi-jinja Shrine is located in Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Ebumi-jinja Shrine is located in Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Ebumi-jinja Shrine is located in Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 毎年5月5日に例大祭が行われる。
sen.e: Rei-taisai (regular rites and festivals) is held on May 5 every year.
Rei-taisai (regular rites and festivals) is held on May 5 every year.
Rei-taisai (regular rites and festivals) is held on May 5 every year.

sen.j: 大原から静原に出る江文峠への峠道の傍らに鎮座する。
sen.e: This shrine is located by the side of the Ebumi mountain path leading from Ohara to Sizuhara.
This shrine is located by the side of the Ebumi mountain path leading from Ohara to Sizuhara.
This shrine is located by the side of the Ebumi mountain path leading from Ohara to Sizuhara.
It is unknown when this shrine was founded.
It is unknown when this shrine was founded.
It is unknown when this shrine was founded.

sen.j: 『延喜式神名帳』に見える「伊多太神社」の継承社とする説もあるが、否定されている。
sen.e: According to one estimate, this shrine was the successor of "Itada-jinja Shrine", which is described in "Engishiki jimmyocho" (a register of shrines in Japan), but this theory is now denied.
According to one estimate, this shrine was the successor of "Itada-jinja Shrine," which is described in "Engishiki jimmyocho" (a register of shrines in Japan), but this theory is now denied.
According to one estimate, this shrine was the successor of 'Itada-jinja Shrine,' which is described in "Engishiki jinmyocho" (a register of shrines in Japan), but this theory is now denied.

sen.j: 後方に聳える江文山（現在の金比羅山）の頂に祀られていた神々を、山麓に社殿を建立して勧請したものとされる。
sen.e: It is beliebed that the deities enshrined at the top of the Ebumi Mountain (present-day Mt. Konpira) behind were divided and transferred to the new shrine built at the foot of the mountain.
It is believed that the deities enshrined behind the top of Ebumi Mountain (present-day Mt. Konpira) were divided and transferred to the new shrine built at the foot of the mountain.
It is believed that the deities enshrined behind the top of Mt. Ebumi (present-day Mt. Konpira) were divided and transferred to the new shrine built at the foot of the mountain.

sen.j: 大原八ヶ町の氏神である。
sen.e: The enshrined deity is Ujigami (a guardian god or spirit of a particular place in the Shinto religion) for 大原八ヶ町.
sen.cmt: 大原八ヶ町の読み不明
sen.e: The enshrined deity is Ujigami (a guardian god or spirit of a particular place in the Shinto religion) for 大原八ヶ町.
The enshrined deity is Ujigami (a guardian god or spirit of a particular place in the Shinto religion) for 大原八ヶ町.

sen.j: また、元来は、毘沙門堂江文寺と合祀されていた。
sen.e: Originally, it was enshrined together with Bishamon-do 江文寺 Temple.
sen.cmt: えぶみでら／えぶみじ の読み不明
sen.e: Originally, it was enshrined together with Bishamon-do 江文寺 Temple.
Originally, it was enshrined together with Bishamon-do 江文寺 Temple.

sen.j: 京都府京都市左京区大原野村町643
sen.e: 643 Oharanomura cho, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture
643 Oharanomura cho, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture
643 Oharanomura cho, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture

sen.j: 京都バス 野村別れバス停留所下車、西に500m。
sen.e: 500m west of the Kyoto Bus Nomura Wakare Stop
500m west of the Kyoto Bus Nomura Wakare Stop
500 m west of the Kyoto Bus Nomura Wakare Stop

sen.j: 京都バス 江文神社前バス停は、春期から秋期の、日曜・祝日のみ運行する95系統のみ停車。
sen.e: Kyoto City Bus Line No. 26 stops at Ebumi-jinja Mae Stop between Spring and Autumn on Sundays and national holidays.
Kyoto City Bus Line No. 26 stops at the Ebumi-jinja Mae Stop between Spring and Autumn on Sundays and national holidays.
Kyoto City Bus Line No. 95 stops at the Ebumi-jinja Mae Stop between Spring and Autumn on Sundays and national holidays.
